habitat_description:
This species is endemic to California and the Baja California peninsula, as well as many islands in the Gulf of California. It occurs in both, desert and coastal slopes of the San Diego County mountains. The Baja California brush lizard can be observed perched on rocks or vegetation in the Pacific islands of Magdalena and Santa Margarita (Grismer 2002).

The preferred habitat is characterized by arid to semiarid regions sparsely vegetated with sycamore, desert willow, and oak trees. It can be found in various habitats such as: chaparral, various woodland types, thornscrub and shrubland (Grismer 1999, 2002; Stebbins 2003).

Associated with oak, desert willow, and sycamore in the chaparral habitat of southern California, and Baja California.
